content.description: Sit start with a good left hand edge and a poor right hand. From there, bump the right hand up through a pinch to a good edge, then bump the left hand up through a series of jugs, and mantel atop using the bumps.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is poor, because a rock that creates an uneven surface.
content.location: It climbs Miner's Delight's east face.

content.description: Sit start with a pair of sidepulls. From there, make a big move to an edge at the lip, the work through edges and bumps to gain the jugs half way up the slab, get the feet out from under, and finish up the remainder to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a few rocks, but they pad well.
content.location: It climbs the north face overhang of Miner's Delight.

content.description: Stand start with a pair of edges six feet off the deck. From there, campus up to a pair of jugs, get your feet, make a big move to the lip, and mantel atop.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good though.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Miner's Delight.

content.description: Sit start matched on an edge. From there, climb straight up through edges to reach a juggy topout.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing has a boulder directly behind it.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Miner's Delight.

content.description: Sit start with a good left hand edge and a right hand pocket (I was fully extended with my arms here). From there, gain a right hand pinch, follow to a left hand bump, work through a gaggle of features to reach the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: A pair of pads. It has a good landing.
content.location: It climbs the south arete of Miner's Delight.

content.description: Sit start with a high right hand pocket and a low left hand edge. From there, climb straight up through a right hand sloper and a left hand pinch to reach a left hand jug before the lip and the easy mantel above.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a large rock behind it that is worth covering.
content.location: It climbs the northwest face of Miner's Delight.
